intro: Asclepiodora zanthodacryon, commonly known as the yellow-veined milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture with prominent veins. Asclepiodora zanthodacryon is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
